newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-India drifts in runup to oil price rise.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-India drifts in runup to oil price rise.

text.p: Indian global depository receipts fell gently Monday in thin trading, as investors marked time in anticipation of an expected petroleum price hike.
"With the overall GDR premium being high, in the absence of any fresh stimulus the market is not likely to bid them up much higher," a trader said.
The petrol price hike is set to be discussed June 15 at a meeting of the 15-party United Front government.
With few exceptions, traders reported little volume in Indian GDRs, with most activity pegged to market markers.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index closed 0.17 points off at 82.49, with the premium over the local market at 25.32 percent from 26.16 percent.
Bombay's benchmark index closed down 1.09 points at 3,835.35.
Reliance gained 12 cents to $19.15/$20.15 and State Bank of India lost 5 cents to $25.10/$25.85.
The HSBC James Capel Korea GDR Index gained 0.96 points to 76.02 points, a premium of 43.94 percent over the local market.
Korea GDRs were helped by falling interest rates in the local market and a stronger yen, traders said. Korean exporters compete with the Japanese and are advantaged by a strong yen.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index gained 0.18 points, or 0.18 percent, to 121.88, representing a discount to the local market of 3.05 percent.
